p: Respiratory viruses spread mainly through direct contact with infected individuals, predominantly through respiratory droplets. While respiratory infections tend to be present throughout the year in warmer areas, in temperate climates these are seen most often in the winter months (see Fig. 1) [ 5] Although some of the new and emergent infections may arise from an animal host, the majority of the respiratory viral infections are spread from other humans. Most of the illnesses are introduced to families by young, school-age children or other caregivers with secondary infections occurring following these initial cases.
